intro: Manglietia maguanica, commonly known as the Guanica manglietia, is a rare and endangered flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Cuba. It belongs to the family Magnoliaceae and is characterized by its large, showy white flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant has simple, alternate leaves that are ovate to elliptic in shape, and it produces capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, it is critically endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
